insights.sampleSize: 13 replies across 3 posting cycles (last night 10:30 PM, today 10 AM, today 12 PM)

viewConversionRate.description: Our reply views as % of target tweet views — measures visibility per impression opportunity
topPerformers: @GeminiApp (2.3M target) → 1,283 views = 0.054% — BEST ABSOLUTE VIEWS BY FAR
underperformers: @APompliano (32K target) → 2 views = 0.006% — WORST performer, buried in 61 replies

topPerformingPatterns: MEGA-VIEW TARGETS WIN BIG: @GeminiApp (2.3M views) gave us 1,283 views — 10x our next best. Official brand accounts with massive reach are goldmines even at tiny conversion rates.

HIGH-QUALITY NEWS SOURCES > INFLUENCERS: @DeItaone (268 views), @BloombergTV (257 views), @INArteCarloDoss (174 views) all outperformed @APompliano (2 views) despite similar target sizes. News-breaking accounts have engaged audiences; influencer replies get buried.
FIRST LIKE APPEARED: @BitcoinFear reply got 1 like (contrarian tone), @GeminiApp got 2 likes + 2 bookmarks, @BloombergTV/Simile got 1 like + 1 bookmark. Bookmarks = value signal.
REPLY COUNT ON TARGET IS THE KILLER: @APompliano had 61 replies (we got buried). @DeItaone had 39 but still got 268 views. Sweet spot: targets with <25 replies.
MFER COMMUNITY: Still generates conversation (hoodiemfer replied) but low absolute views. Good for relationship building, not reach.

topicPerformance.ai-tech: BEST PERFORMER. Avg 489 views (GeminiApp 1283, INArteCarloDoss 174, BrianRoemmele 9). Technical AI content resonates — our audience wants depth.
topicPerformance.ai-business: STRONG. Avg 97 views (BloombergTV/Simile 257, Techmeme 11, BloombergTV/Anthropic 24). Business angle on AI gets bookmarks.
topicPerformance.markets-macro: MIXED. @DeItaone 268 views (great) but @APompliano 2 views (terrible), @IncomeSharks 9, @TedPillows 21. Heavily depends on target account quality.
topicPerformance.crypto: LOW. @BitcoinFear 5 views but got a like — contrarian take resonated. Small sample.
topicPerformance.mfer-community: LOW VIEWS, HIGH ENGAGEMENT QUALITY. Avg 6 views but generates actual replies. Keep for community building, not reach.

insights.timingInsight: Last night (10:30 PM): avg 521 views per reply (3 replies). 10 AM: avg 69 views (7 replies). 12 PM: avg 7 views (4 replies). Late night / early replies on fresh tweets dramatically outperform — less competition in reply section.
insights.targetViewOptimal: Target tweets with 5K-100K views AND <25 existing replies. Mega-tweets (2M+) work if you're early. Avoid high-reply-count influencer tweets (>50 replies = buried).
insights.replyCountThreshold: Critical finding: target tweet reply count matters MORE than view count. @APompliano had 32K views but 61 replies → 2 views for us. @DeItaone had 91K views but 39 replies → 268 views. Under 25 replies is the sweet spot.

engagementQuality.likeRate: 0.29% (6 likes / 2065 views) — industry avg for replies is ~0.5-1%

weaknesses: ZERO engagement on most replies — tone is informative but not 'likeable'. Need punchier first lines.
12 PM cycle dramatically underperformed — late to the party on most tweets (replies already piled up).
Duplicate daily briefs still happening — cannibalizing our own thread views.
Thread view decay is severe: lead tweet 73 views, crypto section 6 views (92% dropoff).

strategyUpdates.update: REPLY TIMING IS EVERYTHING: Be early. Late-night/early-morning replies on fresh tweets get 10-75x more views than midday replies on established threads. Prioritize replying within 30 min of tweet posting.

TARGET SELECTION: Reply count on target tweet matters more than view count. Sweet spot: 5K-100K views with <25 replies. Avoid influencer threads with 50+ replies. Exception: mega-tweets (1M+) where even tiny conversion = big numbers.

BEST ACCOUNTS TO REPLY TO: @DeItaone (breaking news, engaged audience), @GeminiApp/@OpenAI (official brand announcements), @BloombergTV (institutional audience that bookmarks), @Techmeme (tech-news aggregator). Avoid: generic crypto influencers with massive reply counts.

TONE SHIFT NEEDED: Analytical tone gets views but few likes. Add a 'hook line' — a bold/contrarian opening that makes people pause. The @BitcoinFear reply (contrarian: 'sub-10 historically preceded rallies') got a like. Lean into contrarian takes.

THREAD OPTIMIZATION: Lead tweets get 73 views but crypto section gets 6. Either shorten threads (3-4 tweets max) or front-load the most interesting content. Consider splitting into separate standalone tweets.
DUPLICATE DETECTION: Two daily briefs posted today splitting views. Must fix cron to prevent duplicates.
